org.cleartk.classifier.feature.extractor
Class WindowNGramExtractor

java.lang.Object
  org.cleartk.classifier.feature.extractor.WindowNGramExtractor

public class WindowNGramExtractor
extends Object


Copyright (c) 2007-2008, Regents of the University of Colorado
All rights reserved.

Author:
Philip Ogren This class is very similar to the WindowExtractor in the ClearTK project, except that instead of getting individual features for each index in the window (as WindowExtractor does) it creates a single feature that represents an n-gram for all the indexes in the window. As an example, a window extractor that obtains the three words to the left of a focus word would retrieve three annotations following sentence for the word "in":
The blue chair in the corner
The three features would be "The (left 3)", "blue (left 2)", "chair (left 1)". The ngram extractor would retrieve a single feature "The blue chair" - which is the 3-gram preceding "in".

This extractor has a vastly different purpose than the CharacterNGramProliferator which is used to take string features and create prefix/suffix features.

WindowNGramExtractor

public WindowNGramExtractor(String name,
                            Class<? extends Annotation> featureClass,
                            SimpleFeatureExtractor featureExtractor,
                            String ngramOrientation,
                            String ngramDirection,
                            String ngramSeparator,
                            int ngramStart,
                            int ngramEnd)
This feature extractor provides a mechanism for getting features such as:
  • the word trigram to the left or right of a token.
  • get word trigram to the left and right of a constituent bounded by a sentence.
  • get the n-grams "inside" a constituent
  • the pos tag trigram of the three words to the left of a token

Parameters:
name - the name of the extractor
featureClass - the type of the annotations that we are going to extract a feature from
featureExtractor - a feature extractor that will extract features from the annotations of type featureType
ngramOrientation - one of ORIENTATION_LEFT, ORIENTATION_RIGHT, ORIENTATION_MIDDLE, ORIENTATION_MIDDLE_REVERSE
ngramStart - the index (inclusive) of the first annotation of type featureType to examine
ngramEnd - the index (exclusive) of the last annotation to examine.
See Also:
WindowNGramFeature

getStartAnnotation

public Annotation getStartAnnotation(JCas jCas,
                                     Annotation annotation)
This method returns the annotation at index 0 w.r.t. the orientation of the extractor, the annotation we are extracting features for and the ngram the provides the boundaries for feature extraction.

Parameters:
annotation - the annotation of focus for which we are extracting features for
Returns:
the annotation at index 0:
  • for ORIENTATION_LEFT return the annotation adjacent and to the left of annotation
  • for ORIENTATION_RIGHT return the annotation adjacent and to the right of annotation
  • for ORIENTATION_MIDDLE return the left most annotation completely contained in annotation, null if does not exist
  • for ORIENTATION_MIDDLE_REVERSE return the right most annotation completely contained in annotation, null if does not exist
